meanings.definition: The ability to recover quickly from difficulties or setbacks.
meanings.sent1: Her resiliences helped her bounce back from the tough situation.
meanings.sent2: The team showed great resiliences in overcoming the challenges they faced.
meanings.sent3: His resiliences were like a superhero power, always saving the day.
meanings.sent4: The resiliences of the community were tested during the natural disaster.
meanings.sent5: The resiliences of the rubber band made it useful in many situations.

meanings.definition: The capacity to spring back into shape after bending, stretching, or being compressed.
meanings.sent1: The mattress's resiliences ensured a comfortable night's sleep.
meanings.sent2: The trampoline's resiliences allowed for high jumps and flips.
meanings.sent3: The rubber ball's resiliences made it a fun toy for bouncing around.
meanings.sent4: The resiliences of the spring kept the door closed tightly.
meanings.sent5: The resiliences of the elastic band made it perfect for holding things together.

meanings.definition: The ability of a substance or object to spring back into shape; elasticity.
meanings.sent1: The resiliences of the sponge made it easy to wash dishes.
meanings.sent2: The resiliences of the balloon allowed it to expand and contract.
meanings.sent3: The resiliences of the rubber duck made bath time more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: The resiliences of the bungee cord provided a safe and thrilling experience.
meanings.sent5: The resiliences of the slingshot made it a popular toy among kids.
